name: WHYCOMP004: Romance and Random
h4: Winning tracks are featured on "WHYCOMP004 - romance and random"
rules: 1. Deadline: February 1st, 2021
2. If you use samples, they must be royalty free.
3. Theme: __b__Romance and Random__b__

4. __b__Romance__b__: You should create a track that embodies what you love about music; perhaps this means you use your favorite samples or recordings, make a song in your favorite genre, use your most loved ideas in music as inspiration for your song / lyrics, etc.)

5. __b__Random__b__: Your song must include a randomly generated element; perhaps this means you randomly generate midi notes, use automation to randomly design sounds as time progresses in your song, click and point with a blindfold on in your DAW, roll dice for every time you face a choice when producing, etc.
6. You cannot use "romance" or "random" in your track title, as it is the album name.
7. Please render your file properly. It should be a downloadable __b__16 bit 44.1Khz wav file__b__.
8. Submit your final track mixed and mastered below!
recommendations: Use random elements creatively in the structure of your song. Think outside the box; even though "random" sounds chaotic, your role as a music producer is to make a good sounding song, not just random low effort garbage. The better your random element sounds within the context of your arrangement, more chances you have of your song being selected in the final rendition.
Collabs are good ways to make new friends and make cool sounds. Visit our discord to chat with other artists!

resources.Info: Use these assets for promo to invite others to join the contest!

disclosure: Members of WRC will be participating in the competition, as well as judging the tracks submitted. Our goal is to include as many tracks as possible, so we will probably not turn away a track unless it does not follow the rules or fit the criteria for the album. All proceeds made on this album go to the record label and are put towards promotion of the album and other releases.

name: WHYCOMP003: Breaks
description: Breaks and Buttered Popcorn Themed Competition
h4: Winning tracks will be released on "WHYCOMP003 - Breaks", set to release in January 2021
rules: 1. Deadline: January 1st, 2021
2. If you use samples, they must be royalty free.

3. Theme: __b__Breaks and Buttered Popcorn__b__ (you should create a track that used breaks and embodies "buttered popcorn"; perhaps this means you use popcorn recordings, record live breaks using your drum kit, synthesize the sound of a corn kernel popping, use movie theaters as inspiration for your song / lyrics, create a kitchen popcorn soundscape using sounds not heard in the kitchen or from popcorn, etc.)
4. You cannot use "break", "breaks", "butter", "buttered", "pop", "corn", or "popcorn" in your track title, as it is the album name.
5. Your song must include break samples.
6. You are not allowed to use the amen break.
7. Please render your file properly. It should be a downloadable __b__16 bit 44.1Khz wav file__b__.
8. Submit your final track mixed and mastered below!
recommendations: Use breaks creatively in the structure of your song. Think outside the box; the more creative your use of a break sample is while still sounding good, the more chances you have of your song being selected in the final rendition.
Collabs are good ways to make new friends and make cool sounds. Visit our discord to chat with other artists!
disclosure: Members of WRC will be participating in the competition, as well as judging the tracks submitted. Our goal is to include as many tracks as possible, so we will probably not turn away a track unless it does not follow the rules or fit the criteria for the album. All proceeds made on this album go to the record label and are put towards promotion of the album and other releases.

name: WHYCOMP002: Bells
h4: Winning tracks were released on "WHYCOMP002 - Bells", released in December 2020
rules: 1. Deadline: December 1st, 2020
2. If you use samples, they must be royalty free

3. Theme: __b__Bells__b__ (you should create a track that embodies "sleigh bells"; perhaps this means you use bell recordings, synthesize the sound of a sleigh bell, use the festive holiday cheer as inspiration for your song / lyrics, create a winter soundscape using only sounds not heard in the wintertime, etc.)
4. You cannot use "bells" in your track title, as it is the album name

5. Your song must include the following chord: "D-minor 7 flat 5" AKA "F minor 6/A flat". Feel free to use this chord creatively in the harmonic structure of your song, as on its own, it can sound quite dissonant.
6. Please render your file properly. It should be a downloadable __b__16 bit 44.1Khz wav file__b__.
7. Submit your final track mixed and mastered below!
recommendations: Use bells creatively in your final song; the less recognizable a type of bell is, the more chances you have of your song being selected in the final rendition.
Collabs are good ways to make new friends and make cool sounds. Visit our discord to chat with other artists!

resources.Info: Visit this google page to learn more about what makes songs sound festive for the holiday season.

disclosure: Members of WRC will be participating in the competition, as well as judging the tracks submitted. Our goal is to include as many tracks as possible, so we will probably not turn away a track unless it does not follow the rules or fit the criteria for the album. All proceeds made on this album go to the record label and are put towards promotion of the album and other releases.

name: WHYCOMP001: Rain
h4: Winning tracks were released on "WHYCOMP001 - Rain", released in November 2020
rules: 1. Deadline: November 1st, 2020
2. If you use samples, they must be royalty free

3. Theme: __b__Rain__b__ (you should create a track that embodies "rain"; perhaps this means you use rain recordings, synthesize the sound of rain, use rain as an inspiration for your track structure / lyrics, create a rain soundscape using only sounds that are not rain, etc.)
4. You cannot use "Rain" in your track title, as it is the album name
5. No beats (drums can be used, but that kind of defeats the purpose of 'ambient', so use them creatively if you decide to use them at all)
6. Please render your file properly. It should be a downloadable __b__16 bit 44.1Khz wav file__b__.
7. Submit your final track mixed and mastered below!
recommendations: Ambient / Drone / "peaceful noises" / Field Recordings / Sound Scapes / etc. are most likely to be selected for the album
Collabs are good ways to make new friends and make cool sounds. Visit our discord to chat with artists!
disclosure: Members of WRC will be participating in the competition, as well as judging the tracks submitted. Our goal is to include as many tracks as possible, so we will probably not turn away a track unless it does not follow the rules or fit the criteria for the album. All proceeds made on this album go to the record label and are put towards promotion of the album and other releases.
